CatDescriptText: Martin Baxter, pastor, Cleveland and H. Boykin, insurance salesman, Homewood were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, October 22, 1960, pg. A1 with question "Do you think Negro voters consider local or national issues in the casting of their votes?" Mr. Baxter's answer reads: "I think they vote on the national issue of civil rights."  Mr. Boykin's answer reads: "In a national election, as a whole, they are concerned more with national issues...I would not say that generally speaking in the other elections they are more concerned with national issues."
TitMainTitle: Two frames:  Portrait of Martin Baxter wearing Richard Nixon campaign hat and button, standing in front of buildings; Portrait of H. Boykin wearing tweed coat, standing in front of buildings, and signs for shoe repair and artists supplies
